title: Self-Organizing Maps Tutorial
dc:creator: Annalyn Ng
description: Visualize large datasets and identify potential clusters with this special breed of neural networks that uses neurons to learn the intrinsic shape of your data.

media:content.media:title: SOM grids can either be rectangular or hexagonal.
Two color clusters of yellow and green, in 3D and 2D spaces.

Figure 3. Animated GIF showing how an SOM grid evolves to take the shape of our data. Note that the visualization is a top-down view of the data, and the neurons are actually moving in three dimensions
